sentences.sentence: Turkey has approved Sweden's membership into NATO, lifting a major hurdle for the Nordic country's entry into the military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Turkish President Recep Erdogan is poised to formally sign a law which will finally allow Sweden to join NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It comes after the Turkish parliament approved the membership bid by 287 votes to 55, with four abstentions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Erdogan lifted his objection to Sweden's bid during a NATO summit in July last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now the only green light missing is from Hungary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The country's been delaying ratification, alleging that Swedish politicians have told blatant lies about the condition of Hungary's democracy. The Hungarian Prime Minister has invited his Swedish counterpart Ulf Kristersen to Budapest to discuss the Nordic country's entry into NATO. Sweden and Finland abandoned their traditional positions of military non-alignment to seek protection under NATO's security umbrella following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. Finland joined the alliance in April, becoming NATO's 31st member.

sentences.sentence: The latest Russian attacks have attempted to find loopholes in Ukraine's defenses, using a large number of missiles and drones in an apparent effort to saturate the air defense systems.

sentences.sentence: NATO has signed an over one billion euro deal to supply ammunition to Ukraine to help it defeat Russia and to replenish the dwindling stocks of its member countries.

sentences.sentence: Russia's arms industry far outweighs Ukraine's and Kyiv needs help to match Moscow's firepower.

sentences.sentence: The growing death toll and dire humanitarian situation for a ceasefire. fire. Protests by farmers in France have taken a tragic turn after a car crashed into a roadblock

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: His government is the target of much of the farmers' anger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They have blocked roads across the country in protest over falling incomes, rising costs and what they say is excessive regulation of their sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Local officials have also been targeted in other areas, like here, where rubbish was dumped at the gates of a prefecture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With EU elections looming, Macron has tasked his government with finding solutions to the farmers' grievances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Agriculture workers in other European countries have staged similar protests in recent days and their concerns are expected to be a major issue as the bloc votes in June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany's High Court has ruled that the far-right Die Heimat Party will not receive state funding

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: for the next six years because its values and goals are unconstitutional. The German government and Houses of Parliament took the party to court, presenting evidence that they said proved it was racist, with anti-Muslim and anti-Semitic ideology and rejected transgender people.

sentences.sentence: Pressure against the far right has been increasing in Germany after secret meetings came to light about members of the Alternative for Germany party that aimed to expel millions of immigrants from the country.

sentences.sentence: In 2024, Europe is back in space and standing on its own two feet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At the opening of the 16th European Space Conference in Brussels on Tuesday, political and industrial leaders confirmed that the continent will once again be able to rely on its own launchers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The launch window is set between the 15th of June and the 31st of July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Since the end of Ariane 5 in July last year, Europe has been without its own large launcher, a situation that threatens the continent's competitiveness and security.

For the time being Europe must also rely on a number of partners including India and the American company SpaceX.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After an unusual movie year marred by strikes and work stoppages, the Academy Awards showered nominations on Christopher Nolan's blockbuster biopic, Oppenheimer, which came away with a leading 13 nominations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Nolan's three-hour opus, viewed as the best picture frontrunner, received nods for best picture, acting nominations for Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr. and Emily Blunt, and multiple honours for the craft of the drama.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Greta Gerwig's Barbie wasn't far behind with eight nominations, including Best Picture, Ryan Gosling for Best Supporting Actor and two Best Song candidates for What Was I Made For and I'm Just Ken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But Gerwig was surprisingly left out of the Best Director field.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Both Martin Scorsese's epic Killers of the Flower Moon and Yorgo's Lanthimos Poor Things were also widely celebrated.
